meanings.definition: A device used to measure and adjust the potential difference in an electrical circuit.
meanings.sent1: The potentiometer helped the electrician check the voltage in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: I used a potentiometer to make sure the electrical current was at the right level.
meanings.sent3: The potentiometer and the voltmeter had a race to see who could measure the voltage faster.
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like a potentiometer, finely tuning the electrical potential in the system.
meanings.sent5: The potentiometer acted like a detective, uncovering the hidden voltage levels in the circuit.

meanings.definition: A type of variable resistor used to control the flow of electric current.
meanings.sent1: The potentiometer on the control panel adjusted the current smoothly.
meanings.sent2: He turned the potentiometer to increase the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent3: The potentiometer and the light switch had a chat about who had more control over the current.
meanings.sent4: In her hands, the potentiometer was a conductor orchestrating the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The potentiometer was like a traffic cop, directing the electric current in the circuit.
